pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 186, 170, 200]]<|/det|>
# PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 206, 332, 221]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 186, 905, 240]]<|/det|>
0625/13 May/June 2018 45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 248, 588, 291]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Multiple Choice Answer Sheet Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 313, 386, 328]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 343, 890, 415]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. Write your name, Centre number and candidate number on the Answer Sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 430, 890, 460]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 890, 475]]<|/det|>
Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 489, 555, 504]]<|/det|>
Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 518, 764, 578]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer. Any rough working should be done in this booklet. Electronic calculators may be used. Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 99, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 622, 90]]<|/det|>
A length of cotton is measured between two points on a ruler.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 100, 875, 183]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 197, 784, 214]]<|/det|>
When the length of cotton is wound closely around a pen, it goes round six times.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[297, 224, 700, 282]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 295, 462, 312]]<|/det|>
What is the distance once round the pen?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 323, 720, 341]]<|/det|>
**A** 2.2cm **B** 2.6cm **C** 13.2cm **D** 15.6cm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 369, 96, 387]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 369, 687, 387]]<|/det|>
Four balls with different masses are dropped from the heights shown.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 400, 370, 416]]<|/det|>
Air resistance may be ignored.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 430, 482, 447]]<|/det|>
Which ball has the greatest average speed?

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[171, 457, 825, 662]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 696, 96, 715]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 696, 640, 714]]<|/det|>
A car takes 15 minutes to travel along a road that is 20 km long.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 725, 434, 742]]<|/det|>
What is the average speed of the car?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 753, 737, 770]]<|/det|>
**A** 0.75km/h **B** 5.0km/h **C** 80km/h **D** 300km/h

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 73, 97, 90]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 445, 90]]<|/det|> A person steps onto a bathroom scales. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 550, 120]]<|/det|> The bathroom scales records both mass and weight. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 495, 150]]<|/det|> Which row shows the readings on the scales? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 161, 388, 288]]<|/det|>
massweight
A60 N600 kg
B60 kg600 N
C600 kg60 N
D600 N60 kg
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 316, 97, 335]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 316, 593, 335]]<|/det|> Which properties of an object can be changed by a force? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 345, 455, 363]]<|/det|> A direction of motion, mass and speed <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 372, 460, 389]]<|/det|> B direction of motion, shape and speed <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 399, 440, 415]]<|/det|> C direction of motion and speed only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 425, 353, 441]]<|/det|> D mass, shape and speed <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 469, 96, 486]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 469, 748, 486]]<|/det|> A man holds a ladder in four different positions, pivoting around his shoulder. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 500, 688, 516]]<|/det|> The weight of the ladder causes a moment about the man's shoulder. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 530, 460, 546]]<|/det|> In which position is the moment greatest? <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 555, 907, 848]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 73, 94, 90]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 804, 90]]<|/det|> A hole is drilled in a square tile. The diagram shows the tile hanging freely on a nail. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 103, 440, 120]]<|/det|> Where is the centre of mass of the tile? <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[339, 131, 654, 330]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 361, 96, 380]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 361, 721, 378]]<|/det|> Which method of drying clothes has the least impact on the environment? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 390, 697, 406]]<|/det|> A Evaporate the water in them in an electrically heated tumble dryer. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 416, 537, 432]]<|/det|> B Hang them on a washing line in direct sunlight. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 443, 593, 459]]<|/det|> C Remove the water from them in an electric spin dryer. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 469, 434, 485]]<|/det|> D Suspend them close to a coal fire. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[78, 513, 96, 530]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 513, 627, 529]]<|/det|> A student does work by pulling a box across a horizontal floor. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 543, 528, 559]]<|/det|> She now pulls a second box along the same floor. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 572, 702, 588]]<|/det|> Which row indicates that the student is now doing twice as much work? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 600, 532, 747]]<|/det|>
force used to pull boxdistance the box is pulled
Ais doubledis doubled
Bis doubledis halved
Cstays the sameis doubled
Dstays the sameis halved

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 107, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 531, 90]]<|/det|>
A simple barometer includes a column of mercury.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 103, 918, 135]]<|/det|>
Which property of this column of mercury is used to give a measurement of atmospheric pressure?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 146, 344, 163]]<|/det|>
**A** its cross-sectional area

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 173, 231, 189]]<|/det|>
**B** its height

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 199, 280, 215]]<|/det|>
**C** its temperature

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 225, 315, 240]]<|/det|>
**D** its thermal capacity

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 269, 107, 287]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 269, 579, 285]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows some liquid in a measuring cylinder.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 299, 363, 315]]<|/det|>
The mass of the liquid is \(16g.\)

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 325, 555, 508]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 520, 386, 536]]<|/det|>
What is the density of the liquid?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 547, 744, 565]]<|/det|>
**A** \(0.80g / cm^3\) **B** \(1.25g / cm^3\) **C** \(36g / cm^3\) **D** \(320g / cm^3\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 594, 107, 611]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 594, 457, 610]]<|/det|>
Brownian motion of particles is observed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 623, 600, 640]]<|/det|>
Which statements describe the movement of the particles?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 653, 578, 670]]<|/det|>
1 The particles all travel along a curved path.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 680, 470, 696]]<|/det|>
2 The particles move randomly.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 706, 588, 722]]<|/det|>
3 The particles all travel in the same direction.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 734, 141, 753]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 734, 707, 753]]<|/det|>
1 and 3 **B** 1 only **C** 2 and 3 **D** 2 only

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 107, 90]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 897, 90]]<|/det|> A pure liquid is left in an open beaker and some of the liquid molecules escape by evaporation. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 103, 504, 120]]<|/det|> Which statement about this process is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 131, 136, 149]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 131, 578, 148]]<|/det|> None of the escaping molecules return to the liquid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 158, 136, 176]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 158, 677, 175]]<|/det|> The escaping molecules are generally the more energetic ones. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 184, 138, 202]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 184, 919, 216]]<|/det|> The rate of escape of the molecules can be increased by increasing the depth of the liquid in the beaker. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 224, 138, 242]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 224, 855, 241]]<|/det|> The temperature of the remaining liquid is unaffected by the escape of the molecules. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 269, 107, 287]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 269, 757, 287]]<|/det|> A wooden wheel can be strengthened by putting a tight circle of iron around it. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[319, 297, 678, 425]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 439, 651, 456]]<|/det|> Which action would make it easier to fit the circle over the wood? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 467, 134, 485]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 467, 330, 484]]<|/det|> cooling the iron circle <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 494, 332, 510]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 494, 332, 510]]<|/det|> heating the iron circle <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 520, 586, 536]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 520, 586, 536]]<|/det|> heating the wooden wheel and cooling the iron circle <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 546, 700, 562]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 546, 699, 562]]<|/det|> heating the wooden wheel but not heating or cooling the iron circle <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 591, 107, 609]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 591, 755, 607]]<|/det|> A student wishes to calibrate a mercury-in-glass thermometer with a \(^\circ \text{C}\) scale. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 621, 801, 637]]<|/det|> Which values should she use for the lower fixed point and for the upper fixed point? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 650, 656, 777]]<|/det|>
lower fixed pointupper fixed point
Amelting point of iceboiling point of mercury
Bmelting point of iceboiling point of water
Cmelting point of mercuryboiling point of mercury
Dmelting point of mercuryboiling point of water

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 107, 90]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 835, 90]]<|/det|> Which diagram shows how the thermal capacity of a silver object depends on its mass? <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[190, 100, 805, 479]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 508, 107, 526]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 508, 520, 526]]<|/det|> The diagram shows a pan used for cooking food. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[317, 536, 677, 680]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 696, 843, 713]]<|/det|> Which row is correct for the materials used to make the base and the handle of the pan? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 725, 667, 855]]<|/det|>
base of panhandle of pan

amplitude of the wave/cmwavelength of the wave/cm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 107, 90]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 919, 106]]<|/det|> It takes 0.24 seconds for a microwave signal to travel from a transmitting station on Earth to a satellite and then back to the station on Earth. Microwaves travel at \(3.0 \times 10^{8} \text{m/s}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 119, 546, 135]]<|/det|> How far is the transmitting station from the satellite? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 147, 238, 163]]<|/det|> A \(36 000\mathrm{km}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 173, 238, 188]]<|/det|> B \(72 000\mathrm{km}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 199, 270, 214]]<|/det|> C \(36 000 000\mathrm{km}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 225, 270, 240]]<|/det|> D \(72 000 000\mathrm{km}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 269, 107, 288]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 269, 732, 286]]<|/det|> The diagram shows the ranges of human hearing and of ultrasound waves. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[284, 297, 714, 450]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 462, 757, 479]]<|/det|> To which characteristic of sound waves do the numbers on the diagram refer? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 491, 285, 507]]<|/det|> A amplitude in cm <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 517, 285, 533]]<|/det|> B frequency in Hz <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 543, 359, 559]]<|/det|> C speed in metres/second <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 570, 332, 585]]<|/det|> D wavelength in metres <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 615, 107, 632]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 615, 583, 631]]<|/det|> A permanent magnet is placed close to a bar of soft iron. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[178, 640, 819, 680]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 693, 500, 709]]<|/det|> What are the polarities of end P and of end Q? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 721, 348, 850]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 107, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>25</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 918, 106]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a permanent bar magnet placed on a wooden table. A student draws arrows to show the direction of the magnetic field at four points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 117, 693, 135]]<|/det|>
Which arrow shows the direction of the magnetic field at that position?

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[363, 145, 632, 269]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 303, 107, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>26</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 303, 536, 320]]<|/det|>
Which statement about electric charges is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 332, 539, 350]]<|/det|>
A Like charges attract and unlike charges attract.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 357, 529, 375]]<|/det|>
B Like charges attract and unlike charges repel.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 384, 529, 401]]<|/det|>
C Like charges repel and unlike charges attract.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 410, 519, 427]]<|/det|>
D Like charges repel and unlike charges repel.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 454, 107, 473]]<|/det|>
<label>27</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 454, 920, 501]]<|/det|>
The diagrams show two readings on the same ammeter. Reading 1 is taken before the ammeter is connected in a circuit. Reading 2 shows the reading when the ammeter is connected in a circuit.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 510, 781, 712]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 725, 390, 741]]<|/det|>
What is the current in the circuit?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 753, 740, 770]]<|/det|>
A 0.80A B 0.90A C 0.95A D 1.20A

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 107, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>28</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 853, 90]]<|/det|>
A student measures the potential difference across a device and the current in the device.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 103, 553, 120]]<|/det|>
Which calculation gives the resistance of the device?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 132, 400, 149]]<|/det|>
A current + potential difference

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 160, 400, 176]]<|/det|>
B current ÷ potential difference

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 187, 400, 202]]<|/det|>
C potential difference ÷ current

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 214, 400, 229]]<|/det|>
D potential difference × current

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 256, 107, 275]]<|/det|>
<label>29</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 256, 551, 273]]<|/det|>
A battery in an electric circuit is connected to a lamp.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 286, 746, 303]]<|/det|>
Chemical energy in the battery is transferred to which other types of energy?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 314, 317, 330]]<|/det|>
A internal energy only

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 341, 422, 357]]<|/det|>
B kinetic energy and sound energy

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 367, 416, 383]]<|/det|>
C light energy and thermal energy

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 394, 292, 410]]<|/det|>
D light energy only

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 437, 107, 456]]<|/det|>
<label>30</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 437, 578, 454]]<|/det|>
Which component is represented by the symbol shown?

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 465, 560, 485]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 496, 260, 512]]<|/det|>
A fixed resistor

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 523, 191, 538]]<|/det|>
B fuse

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 549, 238, 564]]<|/det|>
C thermistor

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 576, 287, 591]]<|/det|>
D variable resistor

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 107, 90]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 919, 106]]<|/det|> A student sets up a circuit which she calls circuit 1. She records the value of the current \(I_{1}\) , and calculates the resistance \(R_{1}\) of the circuit. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[247, 115, 747, 305]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 318, 918, 351]]<|/det|> She then connects an identical resistor in parallel with the original resistor. She calls this circuit 2. She records current \(I_{2}\) and calculates the total resistance \(R_{2}\) of this circuit. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[115, 364, 827, 380]]<|/det|> Which row correctly compares the two currents and the two resistances in the circuits? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 393, 510, 521]]<|/det|>
\(I_{2}\)\(R_{2}\)
Agreater than \(I_{1}\)greater than \(R_{1}\)
Bgreater than \(I_{1}\)less than \(R_{1}\)
Cless than \(I_{1}\)greater than \(R_{1}\)
Dless than \(I_{1}\)less than \(R_{1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 107, 90]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 738, 90]]<|/det|> A current-carrying conductor placed in a magnetic field experiences a force. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 103, 612, 120]]<|/det|> Which changes result in reversing the direction of the force? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 132, 136, 149]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 132, 628, 148]]<|/det|> Decrease the current, keeping the field direction constant. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 159, 136, 176]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 159, 573, 175]]<|/det|> Increase the current and reverse the field direction. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 185, 136, 203]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 185, 620, 201]]<|/det|> Increase the current, keeping the field direction constant. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 211, 136, 228]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 211, 572, 227]]<|/det|> Reverse the current and reverse the field direction. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 255, 107, 273]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 255, 418, 272]]<|/det|> A solenoid is connected to a battery. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[356, 282, 630, 377]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 394, 784, 410]]<|/det|> Which statement about the magnetic field at the centre of the solenoid is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 422, 490, 438]]<|/det|> 
A The magnetic field along the axis is zero.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 450, 697, 466]]<|/det|>

B The direction of the magnetic field is at an angle of \(45^{\circ}\) to the axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 477, 612, 492]]<|/det|>

C The direction of the magnetic field is parallel to the axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 503, 664, 518]]<|/det|>

D The direction of the magnetic field is perpendicular to the axis.
